executiveSummary: Entrepreneur Paige Hansen pitched her company BAM Buckwheat Milk on Shark Tank, seeking $250,000 for 10% equity. The product aims to promote sustainable agriculture through buckwheat-based, climate-smart plant milk. Despite positive feedback on her mission, all Sharks declined to invest due to taste concerns, early-stage traction, and limited revenue.
nextSteps: Paige plans to continue growing BAM Buckwheat Milk independently, focusing on her upcoming launch with a major retailer that will reduce production costs by 60% and increase distribution.
